meanings.definition: To separate or set apart from others.
meanings.sent1: The teacher segregates the students into groups for the project.
meanings.sent2: The fence segregates the garden from the rest of the yard.
meanings.sent3: The laundry segregates the whites from the colors to avoid mixing.
meanings.sent4: The high wall segregates the two neighboring countries.
meanings.sent5: The dam segregates the river, creating two distinct bodies of water.

meanings.definition: To divide or isolate based on characteristics or qualities.
meanings.sent1: The scientist segregates the samples based on their chemical composition.
meanings.sent2: The policy segregates the employees according to their experience levels.
meanings.sent3: The chef segregates the ingredients to prepare different dishes.
meanings.sent4: The app segregates the photos into different albums for easy access.
meanings.sent5: The algorithm segregates the data into categories for analysis.
